AR05300304-d-05-30-03-PTO.Narrative: CREW 252 WAS SWITCHING OUT THEIR INDUSTRY SET CARS FROM TRACK 11 AND TRACK 1, LINING THEM UP INTO TRACK 15. 05062003-d-05-06-03-UTAX.Narrative: SOUTHBOUND TRAIN #5 (1023,1017,1020) APPROACHED THE 2700 SOUTH GRADE CROSSING AT NORMAL SPEED.  GRADE CROSSING INDICATORS WERE SOLID (GATES, LIGHTS BELL WERE OPERATING NORMAL) AN EASTBOUND AUTO FAILEDTO STOP AT THE GRADE CROSSING AND WAS STRUCK BY THE SOUTHBOUND LIGHT RAIL TRAIN. THE AUTO ALSO STRUCK AND DAMAGED SEVERELY THE SIGNAL HOUSE ELECTRICAL CONNECTION PANEL, DOOR, AND STRUCTURE.  DRIVER OF AUTO WAS INJURED (BROKEN SHOULDER). G5361-d-05-12-03-WC.Narrative: WC TRAIN M34881-11 WAS SHOVING INTO CC'S TRACK 1 IN HAWTHORNE YARD WHEN THE ENGINEER FELT SOMETHINGSTRANGE AND STOPPED THE MOVEMENT. 179208-d-05-10-03-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
179208-d-05-10-03-SOO.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
179208-d-05-10-03-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 287 MADE A PICKUP IN THE WEST YARD AT MILWAUKEE, WI.  AFTER GETTING BACK ONTO THE TRAIN, CONDUCTOR WAS UNABLE TO GET THE AIR BACK AND UPON INSPECTION OF THE TRAIN FOUND A BAD ORDER TRAIN LINE INTHE PICKUP.  TRAIN PULLED BACK UP AND WAS SETTING CARS OUT BACK IN THE YARD .  TRAIN WAS ON NUMBERTWO MAIN TRACK AND DOUBLED TOWARD NO. 1 MAIN AT THE CUTOFF.  DISPATCHER WAS UNABLE TO GIVE THE TRAINA SIGNAL AND AUTHORIZED CREW TO GO BACK INTO THE YARD WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO HAND LINE THE SWITCH ONTO THE NORTH CUTOFF LEAD.  CREW LINED THE POWER SWITCH FOR THE NORTH CUTOFF LEAD AND PROCEEDED TO SHOVE EAST TO SET THE BAD ORDER OUT.  AFTER SETTING THE BAD ORDER, MOVEMENT COMMENCED IN A WESTWARD DIRECTION AND AFTER MOVING APPROXIMATELY 300 FEET THE AIR WENT.  ENGINEER INDICATED HE FELT A SLIGHT TUG WHEN AIR WENT.  UPON INSPECTION, FOUND THREE LOADS AND ONE EMPTY DERAILED.  CREW WAS TESTED UNDERCOMPANY POLICY AND WERE DEADHEADED TO PORTAGE, WI.  TRAIN WAS PULLED UP LEAVING THE NORTH LEAD OUT OF SERVICE.  CAUSE UPDATE AS 9/10/03:  HQ/SYSTEM FAILURE, DUE TO THE LACK OF SCHEMATICS ON THE CTC DISPLAY LACKING THE LOCATION AND POSITION OF THE DUAL CONTROL SWITCH WITHIN A CONTROL POINT, LED ULTIMATELY TO THE INSTRUCTIONS TO THE CREW BY THE RTC TO BE INCOMPLETE, AS THE RULE SPECIFIES THAT THE RTC SHOULD INFORM THE CREW OF WHICH SWITCHES DO NOT SHOW IN CORRESPONDENCE (LINED AND LOCKED).
